headline: Fox Taps Disney Veteran To Shape Creative And Sustain Ad Momentum
summary: Fox (NasdaqGS:FOXA) appointed Lucas P. Aragón as Senior Vice President, Creative at FOX Advertising. Aragón joins from The Walt Disney Company, where he led campaigns for major events and high profile TV series across several networks. He will guide advertising creative strategy and branding initiatives across the FOX Advertising portfolio. For you as an investor looking at media and advertising names, this move highlights the importance of brand and creative direction for companies like...

headline: Netflix Stock Tanks 39% — Is It Too Cheap to Ignore?
summary: Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) won the streaming wars that exploded after the pandemic, outlasting a surge of competitors to stand as the only major service delivering consistent profits. While rivals like Disney (NYSE:DIS) bled red ink, Netflix grew subscribers to over 325 million paid memberships and boosted margins through ad tiers and password crackdowns. But this dominance ... Netflix Stock Tanks 39% — Is It Too Cheap to Ignore?

headline: You’ve vanquished your rival in a CEO succession race. Now, how do you lead them?
summary: Disney’s Josh D’Amaro and Dana Walden give CEOs a real-time case study in managing a peer who wanted your job.

headline: Bob Iger Couldn't Save Disney's Stock. Can New CEO Josh D'Amaro?
summary: Disney has drastically underperformed the S&P 500 in recent years, but that streak could soon come to an end.

headline: Automakers largely sit out 2026 Super Bowl advertising amid industry uncertainty
summary: Automakers are largely sitting on the advertising sidelines during this year's Super Bowl amid broader uncertainty in the U.S. automotive industry.

headline: NFL May Sell Live Games To Streaming Platforms After $100 Million YouTube Deal, Raising Stakes For Disney, NBC And Traditional Partners
summary: The NFL is exploring selling live game rights to streaming and other non-traditional media platforms following its $100 million YouTube deal, a move that could reshape future media rights negotiations with traditional broadcast partners and expand to international games.
